Question - @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA
Why is the wrong health limit applied to Whalleys Quarry Landfill given that our community's health has been affected for many years. My son already has brain scaring & CP. The constant exposure to H2S is causing him headache & nose bleeds! https://t.co/Mo50j35VW5

@BorisJohnson so how about telling @EnvAgency to get it‚Äôs house in order like you‚Äôve done to the bbc ? Better still tell them to get this sorted in Newcastle under Lyme or aren‚Äôt we worth the PR @StinkStopthe

tweets.text: @HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Using WHO guidelines for H2S is a smokescreen. It's impossible to measure with accuracy the effects of molecules of H2S on every adult and child for every minute of the day and night. The agencies need to act on the high volume of complaints and symptoms. That's the evidence.

urls.title: Riverfly Census - Salmon & Trout Conservation
urls.description: The Riverfly Census was a milestone S&TC project which used¬†aquatic¬†insects to tell us about the of the health of our rivers. The study used standardised monitoring of aquatic invertebrates to reveal how pollution from agriculture, sewage-treatment works, septic tanks and chemicals from many sources is killing our rivers. This project has now concluded. However, our [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: @emmadventures @JonnyPolitics @EnvAgencyYNE @RachaelMaskell @YorkCycle @AndyDAgorne I reported the lack of pedestrian crossing to @EnvAgencyYNE and @CityofYork planning enforcement on Sunday 16th May. I'm utterly dismayed to see how little concern there is for safety of pedestrians and cyclists.

Tomorrow @BBCCountryfile reveals the mass housing freeze across England. This includes the protected Wye, where @EnvAgency believes c.60% of the phosphates pollution problem is down to diffuse agriculture. New homes a fraction of nutrient loading yet the sector here is closed. https://t.co/bbI9aq9crS

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Medium term is 15-90 days and so should already have been applied from 11th March. We are now beyond 90 days of AQM and so presumably long term exposure durations, especially if you take into account increased complaints which began in December and so six months ago!

urls.title: Walleys Quarry ‚Äì Staffordshire Landfill
urls.description: Walleys Quarry offers customers a safe disposal method for waste that cannot be otherwise re-used or recycled. Our team of experts carefully manage and monitor the site through a set of tight controls and procedures to the highest standards and ensure compliance with all legal and governmental policies and regulations. We work to minimise any impact on the environment now and for the future of the site. The Walleys Quarry community fund has distributed over ¬£1.7m to community and environmental projects
